{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3400820,"name":"Frank Gonzalez","username":"Ezie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ezie/{size}/177867_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-21T23:13:28.854Z","cooked":"

I am planning on opening a small self run 3D printing business with a few 3D printers I have and a large variety of different materials that I am looking to invest in.
I just wanted to know the communities thoughts on something like this. It would be limited to intercontinental shipping and would require part designs to be sent.
I would also provide print specifications to be listed and will provide an alternative “recommendation” option to those which are unsure of what to put for print options.

Thank you for the insight that is to come, and I wish u all an amazing FRC break!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-21T23:13:28.854Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":96,"reads":496,"readers_count":495,"score":604.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Frank Gonzalez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54906,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coding Monkey"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/1","custom_user_title":"Coding Monkey","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3400822,"name":"Ian Saam","username":"Enjsnake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enjsnake/{size}/201559_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-21T23:19:29.736Z","cooked":"

Yes it never ends but this is my breakdown of the seasons:
Pre season: 75% work 25% hang out
Build Season: 90% work 10% hang out
Post season: 10% work 90% hang out

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T01:54:47.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":418,"readers_count":417,"score":98.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Elliot S","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52963,"username":"Enjsnake","name":"Ian Saam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enjsnake/{size}/201559_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/4","custom_user_title":"Probably CADing | 2877 LigerBots Alum-Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400890,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T02:49:25.260Z","cooked":"
Ezie:

I just wanted to know the communities thoughts on something like this. It would be limited to intercontinental shipping and would require part designs to be sent.

My thought: Who’s your customer? At the high end, you’ve got operations running at vastly larger scale. At the low end, you’ve got folks who’ll drop $200 on an A1 mini and wing it. Figuring out where you sit in that range (and whether there’s enough demand to underpin such a position) is key to success.

Also remember to price in all your costs! Filament, electricity, printer maintenance, tools for post-processing, shipping boxes, shipping labels–it all adds up. If you’re coming in absurdly under a shop like Xometry or PCBWay for the same parts, ask yourself why that is and what you might be forgetting.

I don’t say all this to say “it’s a bad idea”, but hopefully it’ll help you speedrun past a few mistakes.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T02:49:25.260Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":172.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/5","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400947,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T04:58:59.259Z","cooked":"

After helping run a print farm for the Purdue 3D printing club I have some words of advice:

  • You will spend a lot of time helping people with parts that are impossible to print on FDM.
  • It is not if a printer will break, but when it will break. Printing on them almost nonstop adds a lot of wear.
  • Everyone wants to print every color and material under the sun. Everyone also wants to print the same colors at the same time for like a week and then never again.
  • Some parts will get damaged in some ways and will require reprinting which just adds even more cost.
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T04:58:59.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":325,"readers_count":324,"score":125.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Joey Tidrow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1646M 2851A "},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/6","custom_user_title":"1646M 2851A ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400960,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T05:31:38.863Z","cooked":"

Ryan was offering thrifty printing (onyx only) for a hot minute, and a couple other printer based shops have come and gone.

I thought about trying offering fdm swerve tread, but my pricing was about the same as VEX swerve tires so I never bothered to go to market.

Don’t sell for the “estimated cost” in the slicer, my guess is about triple should give you something decent.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T05:34:33.665Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":297,"readers_count":296,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400972,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T10:29:15.833Z","cooked":"

The huge advantage of 3D printing is the flexibility and related ability to iterate. Iteration cycle period is limited by the shipping turnaround time and, unless you’re offering a material/process that can’t be had in a $1K printer, I’m not sure there’s huge value in custom parts.

Stock parts (your designs) could make more sense as you’re bringing design and printing value to the table.

PS: I think you mean intracontinental rather than intercontinental.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T10:29:15.833Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":51.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/8","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400982,"name":"Crystal","username":"CIM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cim/{size}/3861_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T12:37:06.877Z","cooked":"

(Disclosure: I work for Protolabs Network (Hubs), a distributed manufacturing company that produces 3DP, CNC, and sheet metal parts for a variety of customers)

This kind of thing is really hard. FDM printers of acceptable quality for FRC can now be found for as little as $250, so at this point I would assume almost every team that would hear of your services has access to one or more of them. The few teams that do not, are unlikely to hear of or find a small vendor.

You’re also competing with a lot of large commercial services for basic printing. Protolabs Network, Xometry, Fictiv, PCBWay - all exist with great user interfaces, fast lead times, and relatively affordable prices. For the teams who can print basic materials but need engineering materials for the final product, ordering through these services is hard to beat.

Even if you both find a niche with sufficient demand, along with competitive prices / quality / lead times vs a big supplier. Now you have a lot of work to do. How will you manage to control order volume enough to not outstrip your ability to manufacture parts? What happens if your 1-2 printers break? How quickly can your customers expect feedback, or printed parts? Does your engineering advice come with any weight or guarantee if the customer still breaks the parts? What if you get an order that uses a material you have never tried, or requires more material than you can afford? Do you have the time and the means to keep your printer running 24/7?

I don’t mean to discourage you, but this stuff is not really doable as a business on a hobbyist level. It’s not the same level of capital investment, time commitment, etc. as a machine shop, but just being one dude with a printer is challenging for just being a general business anyone can order from. If you want to print more and mess with financing, I’d consider designing and make a useful, niche product. If you want to just print more and help FRC teams, maybe reach out to a few local teams in need and start small, offering to just charge cost of materials or something.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T12:37:06.877Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":110.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Crystal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":11107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Crystal is me (she/they)"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/9","custom_user_title":"Crystal is me (she/they)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400992,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T13:43:22.124Z","cooked":"
CIM:

You’re also competing with a lot of large commercial services for basic printing. Protolabs Network, Xometry, Fictiv, PCBWay - all exist with great user interfaces, fast lead times, and relatively affordable prices.

On top of those, there’s also CraftCloud3D, which is like the others but specifically for 3D printing. (Though, if you were aiming for a broader market, being a vendor on CraftCloud might make sense.)

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T13:43:22.124Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/10","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400995,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T13:51:28.387Z","cooked":"

I have a side business (registered LLC) that designs and prints + cuts custom prints and trophies, mostly for the drone racing community.
I can tell you from experience that cost margins are pretty tough. Most people who don’t already own their own printers severely underestimate the print time/effort required. At best, people are willing to pay about $1.50 per print hour for something they already have an STL for (for example, $30 for a 20 hour long print).
After factoring in material costs, electricity, misprint time/cost, and basic opportunity cost, it’s not really worth it unless you can print exotic materials with special printers like carbon, onyx, etc. Forget PLA/PETG. Really good quality TPU prints are sold quite a bit but still low profit margins.
A laser cutter has yielded much better results, as custom acrylic and wood cuts are hard to make otherwise and are mass produced quickly.

Anyway, by the time you register an LLC, figure out and organize sales tax implications for in-state sales, deal with business tax returns and payments, it becomes a bit of a hassle.

So how do you make this into a good business? Offer unique designs, sell your creativity, and sell your CAD/design work time! This is where the real value comes in. If you design a product that can be printed and is unique + valuable for the community, and can produce them at high quality and in large scale, it can become a great business! Good luck!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T13:51:28.387Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3401001,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T14:19:23.560Z","cooked":"

I’m not going to offer any 3D printing specific advice, as there’s plenty above. And there’s also some great business advice as well (I know @seg9585, he basically has a makerspace in his garage!). So I’ll stick to more philosophical stuff.

If you enjoy tinkering with 3D printing, and you have been making stuff for friends, there’s nothing wrong with expanding this as a side hustle to make some cash. This can help you feel more accomplished, add satisfying/fun work to your free time, and even develop into something you’ll add to you resume.

If you are viewing this as a way to increase the enjoyment you are getting from an activity, ramp it up gradually. Invest what you can afford to keep for hobby activities or afford to lose financially. Carefully consider how the enjoyment may decrease if you are losing money and your free time. (Wait, that’s like mentoring an FRC team…)

It’s great that you are considering an entrepreneurship, and getting advice from more knowledgeable people before diving in. Best of luck!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-22T14:19:23.560Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":131.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467850,"topic_slug":"frc-3d-printing-business","display_username":"Tom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4276 nice mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-3d-printing-business/467850/12","custom_user_title":"4276 nice mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3401043,"name":"Jared Hasen-Klein","username":"jaredhk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredhk/{size}/248125_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-22T17:48:02.380Z","cooked":"

Wow, as someone with a lot of side hustles over the years, @Zook’s advice resonates deeply.

Doing things because you enjoy them are great.
Doing things because they’ll make you some extra cash are great.

Those two buckets are often not the same, and that’s okay.

What’s your why? If you’re doing this to make money, I think some of the business and manufacturing advice would say this is probably not the best path. But if you’re thinking that you love to use a 3D printer and it’s okay if it’s not a lucrative endeavor, enjoy yourself.
